name: Adulthood
projectPageTextLeft:
Project: Adulthood
Tools: Ink, watercolors, acrylic paint
Year: 2017
projectPageTextRight:
The final project I presented as part of my bachelor degree studies in graphic design. 
Growing up I had a real hard time facing adulthood. Each illustration is a snapshot of my new life away from home and family, escorted by my childhood imaginary characters. The scenes are drawn realistically in black ink and are invaded by whimsical, colorful characters that are extracted from my numerous child drawings. The project is a tribute to the wonders of childhood and an attempt to reconcile the grown up and the child.

name: Zahava
description: —Illustration, Graphic Design, Web Design, Print Design
projectPageTextLeft:
Client: Zahava
Services: Graphic Design, Print Design, Web Design, Illustration
Year: 2017—Present
Credits: Jessica Hendricks Yee- Founder and designer
projectPageTextRight: Zahava is a New York-based jewelry line infused with intention and meaning. Inspired by ancient wisdom, Zahava’s collection of Gold Jewelry and Brass Ritual objects is crafted by hand as modern heirlooms, to be passed on from woman to woman. Ethically produced by global metalsmiths, predominantly in Tel Aviv, the Jewelry is crafted in 10k Gold, evocative of antique amulets from another time and place. Throughout the collection, you’ll find symbols like olive branches (for peace), peacocks (for wisdom), and camels (for guidance), based on different belief systems and cultures.

name: Events
projectPageTextLeft:
Client: Private
Services: Graphic Design, Print Design, Illustration, lettering
Year: 2018—2019
projectPageTextRight: Events branding and invitation designs created for various private clients.

name: Popland
projectPageTextLeft:
Project: Popland
Services: Game Design, Illustration
Year: 2017
projectPageTextRight: Popland is a platformer mobile game featuring a saxophone who tries to find the lost notes to famous pop songs of the 20s century. On his journey he will pass through decades such as the 50s and the 60s and will have to be careful when stumbling upon the most vicious enemy of all: junk food. Each decade is designed and inspired by it’s pop culture elements: colors, fashion, items, technology and celebrity icons. Popland was a school project of mine and is inspired by my passion to pop culture and music.

name: Pondichérie
projectPageTextLeft:
Client: Pondichérie
Services: Graphic Design, Print Design
Year: 2018
Credits: Devon Fisher- Founder and designer
projectPageTextRight: Pondichérie is a New York-based line of ethically conscious resortwear. The line features chic handwoven and hand-dyed caftans and dresses with sustainably sourced textiles from India. Pondichérie sets out to employ women in areas that need it most, which is why the textiles used are crafted in India and made locally in New York. Pondichérie’s designs are inspired by travels and are rooted in that incredible jet-set feeling.

name: Tulerie
projectPageTextLeft:
Client: Tulerie
Services: Graphic Design, Web Design
Year: 2018
Credits: Merri Smith- COO & Co-Founder
projectPageTextRight: Tulerie is a New York-based, High-end fashion rental company. Tulerie allows users to rent clothing, shoes, and accessories to one another, with the app acting as a medium for borrowers and lenders.  The invite-only platform is a highly curated community of women who believe in the craftsmanship of designer fashion but sympathize with the effects over-consumption has on our environment.
